speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Jell-o salad with little pear chunks. It's the Wednesday special at the hospital cafeteria. I can't escape it.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: Listen to you. That didn't stop you from eating my dessert.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Well, all right, the profiteroles weren't bad.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: You didn't want me to starve, did you?

speaker: LUCY
line: He ate mine, too. Daddy, why don't you take this before my arm falls off?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Thanks, honey.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Oh.

speaker: IRVING
line: Everybody... One last shot.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: Oh, Dad, do you think we could draw the line at 600 photographs?

speaker: IRVING
line: 601. Quit griping. And hold up that eyesore, Robert. God knows when you're going to win another one.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Irv, you want to think about staying the night? It's awful late to head back to the city.

speaker: IRVING
line: What, I get to stay at the home of the Bay Area Doctor of the Year? It's a deal.

speaker: IRVING
line: Proud of you, Robert. Up, hold it up. Say, "cheese."

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: "Presented to Dr. Robert Wieder, M.D. For the great wisdom skill and compassion he exhibits in the practice of medicine." Going to look awfully nice in your office. What are you thinking?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: How this is just the cherry on top. How lucky I am.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: What is it?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: The downstairs motion sensor.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: You think Dad tripped the alarm?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: The alarm hasn't been tripped. You got me. I'm going to check it out.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Irv? Irving? Is everything all right?

speaker: MULDER
line: What do you think, Scully, is this a name, possibly? Or a code, or an anagram?

speaker: SCULLY
line: "T-h-e-e-f." I assume it's supposed to be t-h-I-e-f-- "thief."

speaker: MULDER
line: Insert your own Dan Quayle joke here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lousy spelling aside, what do you think it refers to? Who's the thief?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that's certainly one question. I've got many.

speaker: MULDER
line: "Mulder, why are we here?"

speaker: SCULLY
line: To be fair, I might have used the words "Mulder, how is this an X-File?"

speaker: MULDER
line: You see that, Scully, you always keep me guessing.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Dr. Irving Thalbro, age 66. Found hanged with his throat cut. His family tucked away and in bed not 40 feet from here didn't see or hear anything.

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: MULDER
line: Except they're the ones that called it in and there's no evidence whatsoever to link them to the crime.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which is why the police are rightly wondering if Dr. Thalbro killed himself.

speaker: MULDER
line: Except who, then, did this? Blood pattern doesn't indicate that the good doctor did it, who I am assuming could read and write above a fourth-grade level.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll admit, Mulder this is not an open and shut case. But, uh … … it doesn't make it an X-File.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, there is one detail that does.

speaker: MULDER
line: This.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dirt?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dirt. It's a very powerful component of hexcraft. As well as the pattern in which it was originally arranged. Check this out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like a human form.

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, that's what it looks like to me. Now, I know what you're going to say, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, hexcraft. I mean, I'll buy that as the intent here. It certainly jibes with the evidence. I say we talk to the family.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll always keep you guessing.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: It was probably the greatest night of my life. Until...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, can you think of any enemies that your father-in-law might have made? Maybe inadvertently through his medical practice or a business dealing, perhaps?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Everybody loved Irving. Everyone who knew him. He was... No. I can't conceive of it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Wieder, do you have any enemies?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry, I have to ask. There was a message left behind. If it doesn't refer to your father-in-law, it may refer to you.

speaker: LUCY
line: "Theef?" Are you asking if my Dad's a thief? He saves people's lives. He's a good man.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Honey...

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: If I have any enemies I don't know them.

speaker: FEMALE REPORTER ON TV
line: ..at the home of his son-in-law. Dr. Robert Wieder, Dr. my understanding that police are treating the case as a murder. This is due in part to clues or evidence left at the scene according to spokesman Dan Merkin who will only characterize them as bizarre or ritualistic. Though Dr. Thalbro's family was in the house at the time of his death, they apparently are not...

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Hello? Mr. Peattie?

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Mr. Peattie, I know you're in there. Are you cooking? You aren't supposed to be cooking.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: You aren't supposed to be cooking.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: That smell like something you want to eat?

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Well, what is it, then?

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Medicine.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Oh, all right, uh... just so long as you're not cooking.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Seems like you could use yourself a poultice for your back. Old Peattie fix you right up. Be ready later.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: MULDER
line: This dirt we found? Gas chromatograph shows pronounced spikes of methane and sulphur compounds - the signature of decay. It's graveyard dirt. Also known as conjure dust. It's one of the most powerful hexing elements whether for good or evil, not the kind of stuff you want to be on the wrong end of.

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: MULDER

speaker: SCULLY
line: Kuru.

speaker: MULDER
line: The, the, the, uh... the disease that New Guinea tribesmen get?

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: MULDER

speaker: SCULLY
line: Practically speaking, Mulder, Kuru doesn't even exist anymore. Not in New Guinea and certainly not in the U.S. But this man's cerebellum and his striatum clearly show signs of it, Mulder. I mean, these... these amyloid plaques? His brain is riddled with them.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kuru makes you crazy, right?

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that's what his autopsy shows. From the wound pattern to the blood spray... this man did it to himself, there's no question.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless... it was inflicted upon him. The graveyard dirt, the hex. He was given this disease so that he would kill himself.

speaker: DR WEIDER
line: Nan? Honey?

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: Robert? Look at this.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: Who would've taken that?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: The police probably. Could be they needed it as evidence.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: That's not what I'm afraid of.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Then you have nothing to worry about.... a good night's sleep.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: I'm telling you, I'm scared. I can't stay here, Robert. I can't live in this house anymore. Lucy can't. Not after what's happened here. And now this picture of us is missing.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: It'll turn up.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: No. Doesn't make any sense. Nothing that's happened here makes any sense.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: It does. Nan... listen to me. Your Dad was ill. He had a kind of progressive dementia. That's what the FBI autopsy showed. I reviewed their findings, and I have to agree. Honey... we will get through this.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Oh, my God! Nan? Honey?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Oh, my god. Nan!

speaker: LUCY

line: Lucy, call 911.

speaker: DR. WIEDER

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Nan!

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Wieder?

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Diffuse cutaneous leishmaniasis. Old world type.

speaker: MULDER
line: I take it that's rare.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In San Francisco? It's unheard of. Maybe in... in Central Africa...

speaker: MULDER

speaker: DR. WIEDER

line: The dirt you found in your bed drawn in the shape of a body. That's indicative of folk magic. That's what I believe is being used against you.

speaker: DR. WIEDER

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, regardless of the particulars I think it's clear that there was an intruder in your home and I think it would be prudent for you to accept our protection and help us to identify this person.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Prudent for me would be to continue treating my wife.

speaker: MULDER
line: If we don't stop who's causing this, your treatments won't matter.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: So... modern medicine, and all it encompasses-- artificial hearts, laser surgery gene therapy, to name a few-- all of that arrayed against a pile of magic dirt... and you tell me I'll lose.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: I have MRIs to look at.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, yeah, Mulder, win him over.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, he will lose unless we can find a way to stop it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you suggest?

speaker: MULDER
line: A second opinion.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Truth always hurts, don't it, Doc?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Is this you? You did this? What do you want from me?

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Oh, don't you be fretting none about that. I gettin' my nickel's worth. You're doing a fine job so far.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: What the hell are you talking about? What is this all about?

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Lynette Peattie. And don't you be saying you don't recollect her, uh-uh! No, no, no.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Look, if I've done anything to upset you, I... It's no use trying to intimidate me if I don't know how I've offended you. Tell me! What makes me a thief?

speaker: PEATTIE
line: You be a smart man. I figure... you ponder it awhile, it gonna come to you.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Wait!

speaker: TECH
line: No, no matter how I spell it, there's no Lynette Peattie.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: She's not in my patient file?

speaker: TECH
line: She's not in any doctor's patient file. No one by that name has ever been admitted to the hospital. You think you treated her?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: What about Jane Does?

speaker: TECH
line: You treated three in the last two years.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Pull the files, please.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: You remember old Boon, I know you do. This mangy old ugly dog.. Smart! People-smart... and then some. Oh, he sure did love you. He crawled up under that house the very day you left... Wouldn't come out for nothin'. Not no ham bone, nothin'. He just knew that his life was over. You stole his heart, too. Oh, you shouldn't oughta left.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Oh, you're there. I'm... wanted to thank you. That poultice... worked a miracle on my back. I was about to knock and... and ask if I could get a little more.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Whatever that is it sure is stinky.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Stinky's good.

speaker: PROPRIETER
line: Good afternoon. Can I help you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, we're looking for some alternative medical advice.

speaker: PROPRIETER
line: Oh, well, you've come to the right place. I get a lot of folks fed up with their HMOs. .

line: Well, actually, we're not here for us.

speaker: PROPRIETER
line: Whoa, Chief... back in your pocket.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's dirt.

line: It's goofer dust is what it is. I don't know what your intentions are with that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Goofer dust?

speaker: MULDER
line: Conjure dust... Goofer dust. How would you go about making somebody sick using that?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're investigating a murder. That's why I'm asking.

speaker: PROPRIETER
line: Oh... Speaking strictly in the academic sense you'd spread it on or near your victim to direct misfortune.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you could give them any illness you wanted? One that you chose specifically for them?

speaker: PROPRIETER
line: Oh... that's a lot trickier. It requires something special.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A voodoo doll.

speaker: PROPRIETER
line: No, they're called "poppets". Inside you place three thorns of a blood red rose, a strand of hair and a photo of your victim. Maybe other items as well. It depends on the operator. You sew it up, say your spell.

speaker: MULDER
line: How would you counteract one of these?

speaker: PROPRIETER
line: It depends on who you're dealing with. But if the person you're looking for is powerful enough to bring about a murder he's probably charmed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Which would mean what?

speaker: PROPRIETER
line: It means just that. He's drawing on the energy of a charm. A source of magic power... It could be any item provided that it's very important to him. Something that holds great meaning for him and unless you can separate him from his charm, you're out of luck.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Poppin' corn.

speaker: TECH
line: You got to put the money in first.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Don't look like no poppin' corn to me.

speaker: TECH
line: Put it in the microwave... then you get your popcorn.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Oh, microwave. I heard tell of such a thing. It's a true wonder.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Radiation... comes from the heart of the atom. I think it be God's own glow.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Honey, she's doing much better. Come see for yourself. You're going to be very happy, I promise. The drug therapy I'm giving her is working wonders. Come on. Come see.

speaker: LUCY
line: Mom.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: Hi, Sweetie.

speaker: LUCY
line: You look good.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: Yeah, right. But I am definitely feeling better.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: So how come I have to go through this thing again?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Come on. This thing gives off about as much radiation as a dental x- ray. Nothing to worry about.

speaker: MRS. WIEDER
line: I know, still scares me. Wish me luck?

speaker: RADIOLOGY TECH
line: Doctor!

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Switch it off. Switch it off!

speaker: PEATTIE
line: All done.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: How could somebody orchestrate all of this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You believe that your wife was murdered?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: It was no accident. There was no malfunction of the machine. Yes, I believe she was murdered.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you still have no idea why?

speaker: MULDER
line: The pathologist found this branded into your wife's chest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, we can't help you if you withhold information from us.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: A man came to see me yesterday. My age, older, maybe. Tall. He mentioned someone named Lynette Peattie. I didn't know who she was at first. Turns out she was a Jane Doe I treated last October. She was in a bus rollover. Came in amid a wave of victims. She was the worst off. I could barely put fluids in fast enough to keep up with the blood loss. We were rushing around, triaging people. Everybody knew she was dying. Was only a matter of time. And she was in agony.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: This was my course of treatment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You gave her morphine. Lots of it.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: I pushed it myself. She kept screaming... and her heart rate kept climbing. So... I kept pushing.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: I took maybe the last 20 minutes of her life. It was a fair trade to make for the pain.

speaker: MULDER
line: Her father doesn't agree.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you think it's her father?

speaker: MULDER
line: He thinks you robbed him of his family, and that's why he's systematically robbing you of yours.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: What am I supposed to do? My... my daughter Lucy.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't do anything. You let us find a way to protect you.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: How?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have an idea where to start.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If Lynette Peattie was Carlos the Jackal I would've had an easier time tracking her down. There's no birth certificate, no social security number, nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Better known to the world as "Jane Doe 6149."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Her name shows up once in the records of a Vista inoculation program-- 1981. The Allegheny mountains of West Virginia.

speaker: MULDER
line: Deepest Appalachia.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's when her father, one Oral Peattie refused to allow her to be inoculated against polio. But there's no address for him. There's no record of him whatsoever. So, Mulder, why are we exhuming this girl?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I'm thinking of her dear old backwoods Dad and where he gets all his graveyard dirt.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Here? His daughter's grave?

speaker: MULDER
line: The cultists we spoke to said that the person casting these magic spells was charmed. That he had a source of power that was very meaningful to him and he kept it close by.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Lynette Peattie's body.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's my guess. So as long as her body remains here resting in peace in the Bay Area, he remains powerful. But if we were to ship it off to Quantico...

speaker: MULDER
line: Hold that.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Mr. Peattie?! Mr. Peattie, my pain's back. I was wondering if I could get a little more of that poultice? Mr. Peattie?

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Phew.

speaker: LANDLADY
line: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't know you were home. I...

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, thank you. They'll be there before dark.

speaker: MULDER
line: You all set?

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: We still don't know where it is we're going?

speaker: MULDER
line: We rented a cabin for you. It's important that you get out of town.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: And you believe by our leaving will somehow weaken him?

line: Well, what's important is that he believes that. At any rate, if he can't find you he can't hurt you.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: How do you know he'll come forward?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because he hasn't gotten everything he wants.

speaker: TV ANCHOR
line: Our own John Gilnitz is on the scene.

speaker: JOHN GILNITZ THE TV REPORTER
line: San Mateo County health officials admit they're at a loss to explain the sudden onset of the 56-year-old woman's bizarre illness but insist there is no cause for alarm.

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Pretty weird, huh?

speaker: JOHN GILNITZ THE TV REPORTER
line: There has been no official diagnosis. Sources say they believe the woman contracted the rare, but deadly, group "A" streptococcus, better known as the "flesh-eating disease."

speaker: SECURITY GUARD
line: Freakin' scary...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Peattie may be on to us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: I found out where he lives only he's cleared out, and he's taken his magic charm with him. At least as much of it as he can carry. My guess is he's looking for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't see anybody following us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Just keep an eye out, Scully. I'm on my way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Soon. Very soon.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: What was that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stay where you are.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: ...Judas goat.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh! Oh, God!

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't see.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Agent Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just stay where you are! Stay down.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Oh, doctor!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Leave him alone!

speaker: LUCY
line: Daddy!

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: Get back. Get back! Don't make me hurt you!

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Can't hurt the man who ain't got nothing left. You know who I be now? Maybe you can recollect my daughter.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: I remember! I never forgot! I'm... I'm sorry for your loss but I did everything humanly possible to save her.

speaker: PEATTIE
line: You arrogant little man.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: I did everything I could! And when I couldn't do any more I eased her suffering!

speaker: PEATTIE
line: By killing her. If I be there... I save her!

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: You weren't there!

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Buried her... in some field. Got no name. Far away from her people. That don't be right. So, now, little man... I gonna show you what be possible. I gonna show you... an eye for an eye.

speaker: DR. WIEDER
line: You're not going to hurt my daughter!

speaker: LUCY
line: Daddy!

speaker: PEATTIE
line: Maybe.

speaker: LUCY
line: Daddy! Daddy!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Doctor... What's happening?

speaker: LUCY
line: Daddy!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Wieder!

speaker: LUCY
line: You're killing him! Oh, Daddy...

speaker: LUCY
line: Stop! Daddy! Daddy!

speaker: MULDER
line: Lynette Peattie's body is on its way back home to Indiola, West Virginia.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's going back to her people after all. You know, Mulder, I would've made the same call... as a doctor... if I was certain that I couldn't save her life and she was in that much pain... I would've done what Wieder did.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm. It seems pretty clear-cut.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Except maybe it's not.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're wondering if maybe Peattie could've saved her life?

speaker: MULDER
line: You do keep me guessing.
